pages.text: Every affix item has a $(9)Rarity$() associated with it. The rarity of the item determines how strong it will be, and what affixes will be applied to it.$(p)A higher rarity is always stronger than the last.

pages.title: Common
pages.text: A $(#808080)Common$() item is the most basic type of affix item.  Each one will always have a single stat bonus, and has a low chance to gain a second.

pages.title: Uncommon
pages.text: An $(#33FF33)Uncommon$() item is a step up from a common item, but still doesn't get any unique effects. These items always have two stat bonuses, and may receive a third.$(p)They may also receive a single socket.

pages.title: Rare
pages.text: $(#5555FF)Rare$() items are where affixes begin to shine. These items receive three stat bonuses and a special effect, and may receive a second effect.$(p)They may also receive a socket, and always have a slight durability bonus.

pages.title: Epic
pages.text: $(#BB00BB)Epic$() items are on the cusp of greatness. They receive three stats and an effect, and may receive a fourth stat and second effect.$(p)They may also receive up to two sockets, and have a stronger durability bonus.

pages.title: Mythic
pages.text: $(#ED7014)Mythic$() items were forged by a lost entity of great power. They receive four stats and two effects, and may receive a third effect as well as three sockets.$(p)They also carry a significant durability bonus.

pages.title: Ancient
pages.text: An $(b)Ancient$() item is the pinnacle of creation, an unimaginable concentration of power bestowed only to the luckiest.$(p)They're so rare, some might say they aren't even implemented yet...
